newsitem.title: USA: First Bank raises prime rate to 8.50 pct.
newsitem.headline: First Bank raises prime rate to 8.50 pct.

text.p: First Bank System Inc said Tuesday it will raise its prime lending rate to 8.50 percent from 8.25 percent, effective March 26.
The move follows a decision by the Federal Reserve to raise the federal funds rate by 25 basis points and to leave the discount rate unchanged.

Tuesday's prime rate hikes mark the first time banks have ratcheted up their lending rates in more than two years. The Fed last altered monetary policy on January 31, 1996, when it lowered both the federal funds rate and the discount rate by 25 basis points.
